item.title: Excerpts from 2020 reading
item.description: Take me to the first quote from: Tristes Tropiques by Claude Levi-Strauss, The Book of Tea by Kakuzo Okakura, The Woodlanders by Thomas Hardy March ðŸ”— Nowadays, being an explorer is a trade, which consists not, as one might think, in discovering hitherto unknown facts after years of study, but in covering a great many miles and assembling lantern-slides or motion pictures, preferably in colour, so as to fill a hall with an audience for several days in succession.
